snippet: The American economy added more jobs in February than in either of the two months preceding it, suggesting winter weather had been the primary obstacle to growth.
abstract: American economy appears to emerge from winter hibernation, adding more jobs in February 2014 than in either of two months preceding it; news suggests that winter weather had been primary obstacle to growth as suspected and that momentum in labor market might gradually build with arrival of spring.
lead_paragraph: The American economy added more jobs in February than in either of the two months preceding it, suggesting winter weather had been the primary obstacle to growth.

headline.main: As Job Creation Increases in February, Economists See Signs of a Spring Thaw
headline.print_headline: As Job Creation Increases in February, Economists See Signs of a Spring Thaw
